meanings.sent1: Moving the furniture around was really discommoding me.
meanings.sent2: Please don't discommoding others by leaving your things everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf enjoyed discommoding the household by hiding the keys.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm discommoded our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The loud construction noise was discommoding the entire neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door was discommoding my concentration.
meanings.sent2: I didn't mean to discommoding you while you were working.
meanings.sent3: The persistent mosquito buzzing around was discommoding everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor discommoded the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The constant honking of car horns was discommoding the residents of the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To put out of order or inconvenience
meanings.sent1: The power outage discommoded the entire building.
meanings.sent2: The broken elevator is discommoding the residents of the apartment complex.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept discommoding the neatly arranged books on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected snowstorm discommoded the travel plans of many commuters.
meanings.sent5: The malfunctioning printer discommoded the office staff during an important meeting.
